intro: Piptoclaina supina, commonly known as the prostrate piptocaula, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
